DataSource.ScriptBody:
Option Explicit
SetLocale("en-us")
Const SCRIPT_NAME = "LogicalDriveStatistics.vbs" Const EVENT_LEVEL_ERROR = 1 Const EVENT_LEVEL_WARNING = 2 Const EVENT_LEVEL_INFO = 4 Const DEBUG_ENABLED = 1001
Dim strComputer, objWMI, objVol, intRC, boolDefrag, objRpt, colVols Dim oOpsMgrAPI, OPBag, intValue, oArgs, strDrive, colDrives Dim bDebug, colProcesses, objProcess, strCurrentUser, User, Domain, strDebuginfo, strEventDescription, sMessage, strMessage, propmessage Dim strVolumeSize, strClusterSize, strUsedSpace, strFreeSpace, strFreeSpacePercent, strTotalPercentFragmentation, strFilePercentFragmentation, strFreeSpacePercentFragmentation, strTotalFiles, strAverageFileSize, strTotalFragmentedFiles, strTotalExcessFragments, strAverageFragmentsPerFile, strTotalPageFileFragments, strTotalFolders, strFragmentedFolders, strExcessFolderFragments, strTotalMFTSize, strMFTRecordCount,strMFTPercentInUse, strTotalMFTFragments
bDebug = CBool(WScript.Arguments(0))
Set oOpsMgrAPI = CreateObject("MOM.ScriptAPI")
Set oArgs = WScript.Arguments If oArgs.Count <1 Then Call oOpsMgrAPI.LogScriptEvent("Windows.LogicalDrives.LogicalDriveStatistics.vbs",100,2,"Script was called with less than 1 argument and was not executed.") WScript.Quit(0) End If
strComputer = "."
set objWMI = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") SET colDrives = objWMI.ExecQuery("select Name from Win32_LogicalDisk")
for each strDrive in ColDrives strDrive = strDrive.Name If ((Mid(strDrive,2,1) <> ":") or (Len(strDrive)> 3)) Then Exit For Else set colVols = objWMI.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_Volume where DriveType = 3 And DriveLetter = '" & strDrive & "'")
for each objVol in colVols
intRC = objVol.DefragAnalysis(boolDefrag, objRpt) if intRC = 0 then
Set OPBag = oOpsMgrAPI.CreatePropertyBag OPBag.AddValue "StatusInstance", strDrive OPBag.AddValue "VolumeSize", Int(objRpt.VolumeSize / 1073741824) OPBag.AddValue "ClusterSize", objRpt.ClusterSize OPBag.AddValue "UsedSpace", Int(objRpt.UsedSpace / 1073741824) OPBag.AddValue "FreeSpace", Int(objRpt.FreeSpace / 1073741824) OPBag.AddValue "FreeSpacePercent", objRpt.FreeSpacePercent OPBag.AddValue "TotalPercentFragmentation", objRpt.TotalPercentFragmentation OPBag.AddValue "FilePercentFragmentation", objRpt.FilePercentFragmentation OPBag.AddValue "FreeSpacePercentFragmentation", objRpt.FreeSpacePercentFragmentation OPBag.AddValue "TotalFiles", objRpt.TotalFiles OPBag.AddValue "AverageFileSize", objRpt.AverageFileSize OPBag.AddValue "TotalFragmentedFiles", objRpt.TotalFragmentedFiles OPBag.AddValue "TotalExcessFragments", objRpt.TotalExcessFragments OPBag.AddValue "AverageFragmentsPerFile", objRpt.AverageFragmentsPerFile OPBag.AddValue "TotalPageFileFragments", objRpt.TotalPageFileFragments OPBag.AddValue "TotalFolders", objRpt.TotalFolders OPBag.AddValue "FragmentedFolders", objRpt.FragmentedFolders OPBag.AddValue "ExcessFolderFragments", objRpt.ExcessFolderFragments OPBag.AddValue "TotalMFTSize", objRpt.TotalMFTSize OPBag.AddValue "MFTRecordCount", objRpt.MFTRecordCount OPBag.AddValue "MFTPercentInUse", objRpt.MFTPercentInUse OPBag.AddValue "TotalMFTFragments", objRpt.TotalMFTFragments
strVolumeSize = objRpt.VolumeSize strClusterSize = objRpt.ClusterSize strUsedSpace = objRpt.UsedSpace strFreeSpace = objRpt.FreeSpace strFreeSpacePercent = objRpt.FreeSpacePercent strTotalPercentFragmentation = objRpt.TotalPercentFragmentation strFilePercentFragmentation = objRpt.FilePercentFragmentation strFreeSpacePercentFragmentation = objRpt.FreeSpacePercentFragmentation strTotalFiles = objRpt.TotalFiles strAverageFileSize = objRpt.AverageFileSize strTotalFragmentedFiles = objRpt.TotalFragmentedFiles strTotalExcessFragments = objRpt.TotalExcessFragments strAverageFragmentsPerFile = objRpt.AverageFragmentsPerFile strTotalPageFileFragments = objRpt.TotalPageFileFragments strTotalFolders = objRpt.TotalFolders strFragmentedFolders = objRpt.FragmentedFolders strExcessFolderFragments = objRpt.ExcessFolderFragments strTotalMFTSize = objRpt.TotalMFTSize strMFTRecordCount = objRpt.MFTRecordCount strMFTPercentInUse = objRpt.MFTPercentInUse strTotalMFTFragments = objRpt.TotalMFTFragments
oOpsMgrAPI.AddItem OPBag
else
strMessage = "Failed to get data for " & strDrive Call oOpsMgrAPI.LogScriptEvent("Windows.LogicalDrives.LogicalDriveStatistics.vbs",2,1025,strMessage) WScript.Quit(0)
end if
Next End If Next
Call oOpsMgrAPI.ReturnItems
propMessage = "Property bag created" & VbCrLf & _ "Drive "& strDrive & VbCrLf & _ "VolumeSize "& strVolumeSize & VbCrLf & _ "ClusterSize "& strClusterSize & VbCrLf & _ "UsedSpace "& strUsedSpace & VbCrLf & _ "FreeSpace "& strFreeSpace & VbCrLf & _ "FreeSpacePercent "& strFreeSpacePercent & VbCrLf & _ "TotalPercentFragmentation "& strTotalPercentFragmentation & VbCrLf & _ "FilePercentFragmentation "& strFilePercentFragmentation & VbCrLf & _ "FreeSpacePercentFragmentation "& strFreeSpacePercentFragmentation & VbCrLf & _ "TotalFiles "& strTotalFiles & VbCrLf & _ "AverageFileSize "& strAverageFileSize & VbCrLf & _ "TotalFragmentedFiles "& strTotalFragmentedFiles & VbCrLf & _ "TotalExcessFragments "& strTotalExcessFragments & VbCrLf & _ "AverageFragmentsPerFile "& strAverageFragmentsPerFile & VbCrLf & _ "TotalPageFileFragments "& strTotalPageFileFragments & VbCrLf & _ "TotalFolders "& strTotalFolders & VbCrLf & _ "FragmentedFolders "& strFragmentedFolders & VbCrLf & _ "ExcessFolderFragments "& strExcessFolderFragments & VbCrLf & _ "TotalMFTSize "& strTotalMFTSize & VbCrLf & _ "MFTRecordCount "& strMFTRecordCount & VbCrLf & _ "MFTPercentInUse "& strMFTPercentInUse & VbCrLf & _ "TotalMFTFragments "& strTotalMFTFragments & VbCrLf
sMessage = sMessage + propMessage
sMessage = sMessage & "Script Ended"
Call LogDebugEvent (DEBUG_ENABLED,sMessage)
Set oOpsMgrAPI = Nothing Set OPBag = Nothing
Sub LogDebugEvent(EventNo,Message)
Message = VbCrLf & Message If bDebug = True Then Call oOpsMgrAPI.LogScriptEvent(SCRIPT_NAME,EventNo,EVENT_LEVEL_INFO,Message) End If
End Sub

ProbeAction.ScriptBody:
Option Explicit
SetLocale("en-us")
Dim strComputer, objWMI, objVol, intRC, boolDefrag, objRpt, colVols Dim oOpsMgrAPI, strDrive, intValue, oArgs
Set oOpsMgrAPI = CreateObject("MOM.ScriptAPI")
Set oArgs = WScript.Arguments strDrive = oArgs.Item(0)
If oArgs.Count <1 Then Call oOpsMgrAPI.LogScriptEvent("Windows.LogicalDrives.FreeSpacePercentFragmentation.vbs",100,2,"Script was called with less than 1 argument and was not executed.") WScript.Quit -1 End If
strComputer = "." set objWMI = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2") set colVols = objWMI.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_Volume where DriveType = 3 and DriveLetter = '" & strDrive & "'")
For Each objVol in colVols intRC = objVol.DefragAnalysis(boolDefrag, objRpt) If intRC = 0 then If boolDefrag = True Then WScript.Echo "You should defragment this volume." Else WScript.Echo "You do not need to defragment this volume." End if Else WScript.Echo "Error performing defrag analysis." WScript.Quit -1 End if
Next

Report.Description: This report shows Free Space of logical disk grouped by computers.

Query.CommandText:
DECLARE @StartDate DATETIME DECLARE @EndDate DATETIME ---DECLARE @FullName VARCHAR(255) DECLARE @ManagedEntityRowId INT DECLARE @MERIOBJ NVARCHAR(255) DECLARE @From DATETIME DECLARE @To DATETIME
SET @To = GETDATE() ; SET @From = DATEADD(MONTH, -1, @To)
SELECT @StartDate = ISNULL(@StartDate, CAST(CAST(DATEADD(DAY, -1, MAX(vPerf.DateTime)) AS INT) AS DATETIME)) FROM OperationsManagerDW.Perf.vPerfRaw AS vPerf
SET @EndDate = ISNULL(@EndDate, CAST(CAST(GETDATE() AS INT) AS DATETIME)) ; SET @FullName = ISNULL(@FullName, 'Microsoft.SystemCenter.AllComputersGroup') ;
BEGIN TRY DROP TABLE #ManagedEntity END TRY BEGIN CATCH END CATCH
CREATE TABLE #ManagedEntity (ManagedEntityRowId INT) CREATE CLUSTERED INDEX IX_ManagedEntity ON #ManagedEntity (ManagedEntityRowId) ;
SELECT @MERIOBJ = '<Data><Objects><Object Use="Containment">' + CAST(ManagedEntityRowId AS VARCHAR(5)) + '</Object></Objects></Data>' FROM OperationsManagerDW.dbo.vManagedEntity WHERE FullName = @FullName
INSERT INTO #ManagedEntity EXEC [OperationsManagerDW].[dbo].[Microsoft_SystemCenter_DataWarehouse_Report_Library_ReportObjectListParse] @From, @To, @MERIOBJ
SELECT vME.Path AS Computer , vPRI.InstanceName AS LogicalDisk, CAST(MAX(CASE WHEN vPR.CounterName = 'Free Megabytes' THEN vPerf.SampleValue END) AS INT) AS FreeMegabytes, CAST(MAX(CASE WHEN vPR.CounterName = '% Free Space' THEN vPerf.SampleValue END) AS INT) AS ProcFreeSpace, MAX(vPerf.DateTime) AS DateTime FROM OperationsManagerDW.dbo.vPerformanceRule vPR INNER JOIN OperationsManagerDW.dbo.vPerformanceRuleInstance vPRI ON (vPR.ObjectName = 'LogicalDisk' AND vPR.countername IN ('% Free Space', 'Free Megabytes') AND vPR.RuleRowId = vPRI.RuleRowId AND LEFT(vPRI.InstanceName, 1) NOT IN ('drivename')) INNER JOIN OperationsManagerDW.Perf.vPerfRaw vPerf ON (vPRI.PerformanceRuleInstanceRowId = vPerf.PerformanceRuleInstanceRowId AND vPerf.DateTime BETWEEN @StartDate AND @EndDate) INNER JOIN OperationsManagerDW.dbo.vManagedEntity vME ON ( vPerf.ManagedEntityRowId = vME.ManagedEntityRowId ) INNER JOIN #ManagedEntity ME ON ( ME.ManagedEntityRowId = vME.ManagedEntityRowId ) GROUP BY vME.Path , vPRI.InstanceName ORDER BY Computer , LogicalDisk
SELECT FullName, DisplayName FROM OperationsManagerDW.dbo.vManagedEntity with (nolock) where Path is null and FullName not like '%:%' and DisplayName like '%Computer%'

Textbox.Name: textbox19
Textbox.Value: ="Execution Time: " + IIf(System.DateTime.Now.Subtract(Globals!ExecutionTime).TotalSeconds < 1, "0 seconds", ( IIf(System.DateTime.Now.Subtract(Globals!ExecutionTime).Hours > 0, System.DateTime.Now.Subtract(Globals!ExecutionTime).Hours & " hour(s), ", "") + IIf(System.DateTime.Now.Subtract(Globals!ExecutionTime).Minutes > 0, System.DateTime.Now.Subtract(Globals!ExecutionTime).Minutes & " minute(s), ", "") + IIf(System.DateTime.Now.Subtract(Globals!ExecutionTime).Seconds > 0, System.DateTime.Now.Subtract(Globals!ExecutionTime).Seconds & " second(s)", "")) ) & " at server: " & Globals!ReportServerUrl

DisplayString.Name: Windows Logical Drives
DisplayString.Description: This management pack provides statistical information on Windows logical disk drives.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This management pack collects logical drive statistics and provides analytical tasks.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This tasks analyzes the selected drive and advises whether the drive should be defragmented.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects average file size data from every logical drive.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This rule uses a data source module and utilizes cookdown to prevent the script within the data source running multiple times. If any overrides are required on this rule, also place the same override on all other Windows.LogicalDrives data collection rules otherwise cookdown will be broken.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects average fragments per file data from every logical drive.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This rule uses a data source module and utilizes cookdown to prevent the script within the data source running multiple times. If any overrides are required on this rule, also place the same override on all other Windows.LogicalDrives data collection rules otherwise cookdown will be broken.

maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects cluster size data from every logical drive.

If any overrides are required on this rule, also place the same override on all other Windows.LogicalDrives data collection rules otherwise cookdown will be broken.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This management pack collects logical drive statistics and provides analytical tasks.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This tasks analyzes the selected drive and advises whether the drive should be defragmented.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects average file size data from every logical drive.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This rule uses a data source module and utilizes cook down to prevent the script within the data source running multiple times. If any overrides are required on this rule, also place the same override on all other Windows.LogicalDrives data collection rules otherwise cook down will be broken.

maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects average fragments per file data from every logical drive.

If any overrides are required on this rule, also place the same override on all other Windows.LogicalDrives data collection rules otherwise cook down will be broken.

If any overrides are required on this rule, also place the same override on all other Windows.LogicalDrives data collection rules otherwise cook down will be broken.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This rule uses a data source module and utilizes cook down to prevent the script within the data source running multiple times. If any overrides are required on this rule, also place the same override on all other Windows.LogicalDrives data collection rules otherwise cook down will be broken.
